item.source: Okay need best coder to help with this ( just 1 thing )

item.title: Okay need best coder to help with this ( just 1 thing )
item.dc:creator: @yppman yppman
item.description:
@yppman wrote:

OH MY FREAKING GOD PEOPLES. This is incredibly easy. You have this:

case 28164: int Points = pkpoints; if(Points >= 10) { addItem(*blue party hat*, 1); pkpoints -= 10; sendMessage("You purchase a blue partyhat"); } else if(Points <= 9) { sendMessage("You need 10 PK Points to purchase a blue party hat."); } break;
Take it all change to this:

case 28164: if(pkpoints >= 10) { addItem(*blue party hat*, 1); pkpoints -= 10; sendMessage("You purchase a blue partyhat"); } else if(pkpoints < 10) { sendMessage("You need 10 PK Points to purchase a blue party hat."); } break;
Or if you want to keep the points thing even though it’s useless extra code, but above is reccomended:

case 28164: int shopPoints = pkpoints; if(shopPoints >= 10) { addItem(*blue party hat*, 1); pkpoints -= 10; sendMessage("You purchase a blue partyhat"); } else if(shopPoints <= 9) { sendMessage("You need 10 PK Points to purchase a blue party hat."); } break;

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fir3_Flam3 Fir3 Flam3
item.description:
@Fir3_Flam3 wrote:

Something like:

case 28164:
int Points = pkpoints;
if(Points >= 10)
{
addItem(*blue party hat*, 1);
pkpoints -= 10;
sendMessage("You purchase a blue partyhat");
}
else if(Points <= 9)
{
sendMessage("You need 10 PK Points to purchase a blue party hat.");
}
break;
